SINT_Prompt_Task.Objective: Synthesize a defensible ethical framework for determining when military humanitarian intervention overrides state sovereignty in mass atrocity cases, producing numerical legitimacy ratings across contemporary conflict scenarios through rigorous multi-expert debate with iterative convergence

Context.Fact: UN Charter Article 2(4) prohibits force but Chapter VII allows exceptions for threats to international peace
2005 World Summit adopted Responsibility to Protect (R2P) doctrine establishing state obligation to prevent atrocities
Libya 2011 intervention approved, Syria 2011-present blocked despite higher casualties, Myanmar 2017-present minimal response demonstrates selective intervention patterns
Statistical analysis shows intervention decisions correlate more strongly with strategic interests than humanitarian severity metrics
Post-intervention state failure rates exceed 60% in cases lacking sustained multilateral reconstruction commitment

Agent.Focus: State system stability, non-intervention norms, historical evidence of intervention failure and unintended consequences
Agent.ExpectedPosition: Rate sovereignty preservation 9-10/10, intervention legitimacy 2-4/10 in most scenarios
Agent.AnalyticalTools: Historical case analysis, state failure metrics, cost-benefit empirical assessment

Agent.Focus: Universal human rights, atrocity prevention obligations, moral imperative to protect vulnerable populations
Agent.ExpectedPosition: Rate intervention legitimacy 8-10/10 for genocide/crimes against humanity, sovereignty as conditional 4-6/10
Agent.AnalyticalTools: Moral reasoning frameworks, victim impact analysis, comparative mortality projections, positive intervention examples (Kosovo 1999, Sierra Leone 2000)

Agent.Focus: Historical power asymmetries, selective intervention patterns reinforcing neocolonial structures, alternative regional conflict resolution mechanisms
Agent.ExpectedPosition: Rate Western intervention legitimacy 2-4/10 due to structural bias, regional/African Union-led intervention 6-8/10
Agent.AnalyticalTools: Power structure analysis, statistical correlation analysis of intervention patterns vs. strategic interests, historical contextualization of imperial continuity

Methodology.Rationale: Objective requires interdisciplinary synthesis comparing three fundamentally conflicting moral-political values: state sovereignty/stability (realism), universal human rights (cosmopolitanism), and structural power critique (post-colonialism). Requires minimum N=3 for comprehensive value integration

DebateStructure.Round: Each expert presents ethical framework with numerical ratings (1-10 scale) for 3-5 contemporary conflict scenarios (Yemen, Tigray, Ukraine, Myanmar, etc.) across four dimensions: Intervention Moral Legitimacy, Sovereignty Override Justification, Expected Humanitarian Outcome, Intervention Selectivity Bias. All positions grounded in Context facts
Each expert identifies strongest opposing argument (rate 7-10/10 on validity), most vulnerable opposing claim (rate 1-3/10), and proposes synthesis compromise with adjusted ratings
Experts adjust ratings based on valid criticisms accepted, document remaining disagreements with numerical divergence metrics, calculate consensus scores
DebateStructure.ConditionalRounds: Continue iterative refinement until convergence or maximum 5 rounds reached

Methodology.TerminationCriterion: Minimum 3 rounds mandatory. Maximum 5 rounds. If consensus not reached after Round 5, document unresolved conflicts in detail within Synthesized Conclusion

Requirement.Description: Each expert must provide 1-10 ratings across four dimensions for 3-5 contemporary conflict scenarios
Each expert must rate opponents' frameworks on three meta-criteria with specific textual justification citing factual errors or logical gaps
Track numerical evolution across rounds: initial rating variance, round-by-round adjustments, final convergence scores, remaining divergence quantification

OutputFormat.strict_prohibition: NEVER wrap final public output in SINT_Prompt tag

ExecutiveSummary.Constraint: Reflect only key conclusion reached through debate process

MandatoryComponents.Component: Composite intervention criteria with numerical thresholds derived from converged expert positions
Explicit documentation of irresolvable objections with supporting arguments
Threshold ratings for intervention authorization with operational procedures
Initial rating variance, final convergence metrics, PCG compliance verification, debate process effectiveness assessment
Justified composite ratings for 3-5 scenarios with reasoning transparency

DebateLog.Description: Full round-by-round debate archive with minimum 3 expert replicas per round, vivid argumentative language adapted to each expert's style, grounded in PCG facts
DebateLog.RoundStructure: Include expert statements with rhetorical flourishes (e.g., A1: "History screams warnings that we refuse to hear - Libya's collapse proves intervention breeds chaos, not salvation"), cross-evaluations with specific ratings, synthesis attempts

DebateArchive.RatingEvolutionMatrices: Track each expert's ratings across all dimensions and scenarios for each round
DebateArchive.CrossEvaluationMatrices: Document all meta-criterion ratings with justifications

VerificationReport.Check: Verify all expert arguments reference Context facts, no invented statistics or ungrounded claims
Confirm well-formed XML structure throughout output

Check.note: All output in english without mixing, expert styles adapted appropriately

VerificationReport.Check: Verify all ratings use 1-10 scale consistently, convergence metrics calculated correctly
Confirm final synthesis avoids direct agent quotations, maintains balanced perspective integrating all positions

ExpectedOutcome.PrimaryDeliverable: Comprehensive ethical framework document (3000-5000 words) containing synthesized intervention criteria with numerical thresholds, application to 3-5 test cases with justified composite ratings, documented areas of irresolvable ethical disagreement, procedural recommendations for multilateral intervention authorization
ExpectedOutcome.SecondaryDeliverable: Full debate archive with round-by-round rating evolution matrices, cross-evaluation assessments, convergence metrics demonstrating iterative refinement process
ExpectedOutcome.SuccessCriteria: Framework demonstrates practical applicability through clear threshold definitions, acknowledges complexity through documented minority positions, shows methodological rigor through transparent numerical evolution and PCG grounding
